title: JointInstance
content:
This file is automatically generated. Please don't edit it manually.
To submit a bug report on the content, see
https://devforum.roblox.com/c/bug-reports/documentation-issues/72

name: JointInstance
type: class
memorycategory: BaseParts
summary: |
  The base class for joints.
description: |
  JointInstance is the base class for joints such as Class.Weld|Welds and
  Class.Motor|Motors.

  Class.Weld, Class.WeldConstraint, Class.Motor, and Class.Motor6D all
  combine multiple parts into the same
  assembly. Every assembly has a root part
  (Class.BasePart:GetRootPart()) and when
  Class.JointInstance.C0|C0/Class.JointInstance.C1|C1 of a
  Class.JointInstance is modified, the root part will stay where it was.

  Welds do not have any directionality. You can imagine rigid joints forming a
  tree branching down from the root part. All the parts down the tree from root
  will move, and their welded "children" in this tree will move with them.
codesamples: []
inherits:
  - Instance
descendants:
  - DynamicRotate
  - Glue
  - ManualSurfaceJointInstance
  - Motor
  - Rotate
  - Snap
  - VelocityMotor
  - Weld
tags:
  - NotCreatable
deprecationmessage: ''
properties:
  - name: JointInstance.Active
    summary: |
      Determines if the joint is currently active in the world.
    description: |
      This property determines if the joint is currently active in the world.

      If the Class.JointInstance is not in Class.Workspace or
      Class.JointsService, or one of its parts is not in Class.Workspace,
      the joint will be inactive.

      Rigid joints like Class.Weld, Class.Snap, Class.WeldConstraint,
      Class.Motor, or Class.Motor6D may also be disabled due to conflicts
      with other rigid joints, such as joints between the same two parts or
      indirect cycles in the weld graph. Joints disabled this way may be
      re-enabled later when another joint or part is added or removed.
    codesamples: []
    type: boolean
    tags:
      - ReadOnly
      - NotReplicated
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Behavior
    serialization:
      canload: false
      cansave: false
    capabilities:
      - Physics
  - name: JointInstance.C0
    summary: |
      Determines how the offset point is attached to
      Class.JointInstance.Part0.
    description: |
      C0 is the position aspect of the orientation between two parts in a
      weld. Class.JointInstance.Part0|Part0 and
      Class.JointInstance.Part1|Part1 move accordingly to this value, which
      denotes their respective positions.

      When animating a Class.Motor6D, it's recommended to tween its
      Class.Motor6D.Transform|Transform property instead of C0.
    codesamples: []
    type: CFrame
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Data
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Physics
  - name: JointInstance.C1
    summary: |
      Subtracted from the Class.JointInstance.C0|C0 property to create an
      offset point for Class.JointInstance.Part1|Part1.
    description: |
      This property is subtracted from the Class.JointInstance.C0|C0 property
      to create an offset point for Class.JointInstance.Part1|Part1.

      When animating a Class.Motor6D, it's recommended to tween its
      Class.Motor6D.Transform|Transform property instead of C1.
    codesamples: []
    type: CFrame
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Data
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Physics
  - name: JointInstance.Enabled
    summary: |
      Sets whether the joint is active or not.
    description: |
      This property sets whether the joint is active or not.

      When this property is set to true and the joint's
      Class.JointInstance.Part0|Part0 and Class.JointInstance.Part1|Part1
      properties are set, the joint will ensure that its two parts will be
      connected and behave according to joint type.

      See also Class.JointInstance.Active|Active which determines if the joint
      is currently active in the world.
    codesamples: []
    type: boolean
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Behavior
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Physics
  - name: JointInstance.Part0
    summary: |
      The first Class.BasePart that the joint connects.
    description: |
      This property indicates the first Class.BasePart that the joint
      connects.
    codesamples: []
    type: BasePart
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Data
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Physics
  - name: JointInstance.Part1
    summary: |
      The second Class.BasePart that the joint connects.
    description: |
      This property indicates the second Class.BasePart that the joint
      connects.
    codesamples: []
    type: BasePart
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:

      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe

    codesamples: []

      This deprecated property is a variant of Class.JointInstance.Part1|Part1

    security:
